oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon portrait of James Willis Siler
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Pvt. James W. Siler, Co. B, 33rd Tenn. Inf. Regt., CSA, was from Hardeman County, Tenn. He served as a teamster, the company wagon driver, and fought at Shiloh. Siler was captured twice and sent to Alton Prison, Ill. Harsh conditions there resulted in a mortality rate that was above average for Union prisons.
